head.supplied: 19/7/90. ¶ ¶ In reply to your kind letter, ¶ dear Dr Gagliardi, I would advise that the Kon. Nederl. meteorol. Inst in Utrecht may receive direct from you the "Myoporinae" ¶ in return for its publi...

div.p: No. 90-1109, unit 149, VPRS 805 inward and outward correspondence — subject, VA 913 Public Library of Victoria, Public Record Office, Victoria.

In reply to your kind letter,
See F. Gagliardi to M, 26 June 1890 (in this edition as 90-06-26a). dear Dr Gagliardi, I would advise that the Kon. Nederl. meteorol. Inst in Utrecht may receive direct from you the "Myoporinae"
B86.08.05. in return for its publications, with an intimation, that the volume with the descriptive text had not yet appeared but would come later.
In the event, no such volume was published.

If you will send me a set of the Iconography of Australian Acacias,
B87.13.04, B88.13.01. so far as you have it, in return for the periodicals now forwarded, I shall feel obliged. I will forward more publications, which I can spare here, in the course of this month.
MS annotation dated 18 August 1890: 'A copy of the Myoporinae to be forwarded to Holland, with an intimation that the text had not yet been published but when issued will be forwarded. A copy of the "Australian Acacias" to be obtained from Mr. Neville and forwarded to Baron von Mueller'. [Alfred Neville was an assistant at the Public Library, his duties being described as having 'charge of newspaper room and of lending library, and business pertaining thereto' ('Blue Book' for 1890, p. 39).] A letter was sent to M on 19 August; letter not found but see M to F. Gagliardi, 20 August 1890. The Myoporinae was 'forwarded as desired' on 28 August.
